set_reservation.name: Set Reservation
set_reservation.description: Create or update a single reservation schedule entry. Reservations allow automatic mode and temperature changes at scheduled times. The device supports up to 7 reservation entries.

device_id.name: Device
device_id.description: The target NWP500 water heater device

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether this reservation entry is active

days.name: Days
days.description: Days of the week for this reservation. Select one or more days.

hour.name: Hour
hour.description: Hour of day (0-23) when reservation activates

minute.name: Minute
minute.description: Minute of hour (0-59) when reservation activates

mode.name: Operation Mode
mode.description: DHW operation mode to set when reservation activates

temperature.name: Temperature
temperature.description: Target temperature in Fahrenheit (80-150Â°F). Required for heating modes, ignored for vacation and power off modes.

update_reservations.name: Update All Reservations
update_reservations.description: Replace all reservation schedules with a new set. This is an advanced service that allows setting multiple reservations at once. Use set_reservation for simpler single-entry updates.

device_id.name: Device
device_id.description: The target NWP500 water heater device

reservations.name: Reservations
reservations.description: List of reservation entries. Each entry should be a dictionary with keys: enable (1=enabled, 2=disabled), week (day bitfield), hour (0-23), min (0-59), mode (1-6), param (temperature in half-degrees Celsius). Use the set_reservation service for a simpler interface.

enabled.name: System Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the reservation system is enabled overall

clear_reservations.name: Clear All Reservations
clear_reservations.description: Remove all reservation schedules from the device

device_id.name: Device

request_reservations.name: Request Reservations
request_reservations.description: Request the current reservation schedules from the device. The response will be logged and can be viewed in Home Assistant logs with debug logging enabled for this integration.
